Articles.Content: I\'m looking for the coordinates of a perfectly flat area on the Mun. I\'m trying to set up a MunBase, but I want to put it on a flat area and I can\'t find one. If you know where one is, please let me know!
But that would take all the fun out it!
Hint: on Earth\'s Moon, some of the craters formed early in its history became partly filled with molten lava.

Hint: on Earth\'s Moon, some of the craters formed early in its history became partly filled with molten lava.

I know that and I\'ve found flatish areas in craters, but I haven\'t found any completely flat areas.
Ah, but if we told you, that would be no fun...
There\'s a nice almost perfectly level area around the \'first\' Munolith. Find that and you\'ve found flat ground

Seems like a good spot to establish a 'research facility', you know, to study the artifact. (Although the munolith aliens might see it as a gaggle of chanting primitives who can\'t even form a neat circle when they worship.)

Latitude: -39

Longitude: 7,8

Around there is a flat area. It looks like one from 3500 meters at least.

Seems like a good spot to establish a 'research facility', you know, to study the artifact. (Although the munolith aliens might see it as a gaggle of chanting primitives who can\'t even form a neat circle when they worship.)

That\'s exactly what I\'m in the middle of doing, though I\'ve just found another Munolith in a deep pit so thinking about a new, more Kerbal base there
Maybe the Mun height map project from the plugins forum can help you to find more even more flat areas...
